knife 0.5.0 documentation

knife.lazy.cmpknife — Lazier evaluated comparing knife

«  knife.lazy.lazyknife — Lazier evaluated combo knife   ::   Contents   ::   knife.lazy.filterknife — Lazier evaluated filtering knife  »

knife.lazy.cmpknife — Lazier evaluated comparing knife¶

class knife.lazy.cmpknife(*things, **kw)¶

Lazily evaluated comparing knife.

Comparison operations for incoming things.

>>> from knife.lazy import cmpknife
__init__(*things, snapshots=5)¶

Initialize knife.

Parameters:
  • things – incoming things
  • snapshots (integer) – snapshots to keep (default: 5)
__len__()¶

Number of incoming things.

__iter__()¶

Iterate over outgoing things.

all()¶

Discover if worker() is True for every incoming thing.

Return type:self (a knife object) 
>>> from knife import __
>>> __(2, 4, 6, 8).worker(lambda x: x % 2 == 0).all().get()
True
any()¶

Discover if worker() is True for any incoming thing.

Return type:self (a knife object) 
>>> __(1, 4, 5, 9).worker(lambda x: x % 2 == 0).any().get()
True
append(*things)¶

Insert things after other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
Return type:self (knife object) 
>>> from knife import __
>>> __(3, 4, 5).append(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6).peek()
[3, 4, 5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
ascii(errors='strict')¶

byte encode() outgoing things with the 'ascii' codec.

Parameters:errors (string) – error handling for decoding issues
Return type:self (knife object) 
>>> from stuf.six import u, b
>>> test = __([1], True, r't', b('i'), u('g'), None, (1,))
>>> test.ascii().oneach().peek()
['[1]', 'True', 't', 'i', 'g', 'None', '(1,)']
back()¶

Switch back to the previous knife object that piped its incoming things through this knife.

baseline()¶

Restore incoming things to baseline snapshot().

Return type:self (knife object) 
>>> from knife import __
>>> undone = __(1, 2, 3).prepend(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
>>> undone.peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3]
>>> undone.snapshot().append(1).append(2).peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3, 1, 2]
>>> undone.baseline().peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3]
bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

byte encode() outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) – error handling for encoding issues
Return type:

self (knife object)

 
>>> test = __([1], True, r't', b('i'), u('g'), None, (1,))
>>> test.bytes().oneach().peek()
['[1]', 'True', 't', 'i', 'g', 'None', '(1,)']
clear()¶

Clear everything.

Return type:self (knife object)
difference(symmetric=False)¶

Discover difference within a series of iterable incoming things.

Parameters:symmetric (boolean) – use symmetric difference
Return type:self (a knife object) 
>>> # default behavior
>>> test = __([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], [5, 2, 10], [10, 11, 2])
>>> test.difference().get()
[1, 3, 4]
>>> # symmetric difference
>>> test.original().difference(symmetric=True).get()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 11]
get()¶

Return outgoing things wrapped with wrap().

If there’s only one outgoing thing, only that thing will be returned. If there are multiple outgoing things, they will be returned wrapped with wrap().

intersection()¶

Discover intersection within a series of iterable incoming things.

Return type:self (a knife object) 
>>> __([1, 2, 3], [101, 2, 1, 10], [2, 1]).intersection().get()
[1, 2]
oneach()¶

Toggle whether each outgoing thing should be individually wrapped with wrap() or whether all outgoing things should be wrapped with wrap() all at once.

Default behavior is to wrap() everything at once. The default behavior is reverted to after get() or peek() is invoked.

Return type:self (knife object)
original()¶

Restore incoming things to original snapshot.

Return type:self (knife object) 
>>> undone = __(1, 2, 3).prepend(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
>>> undone.peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3]
>>> undone.original().peek()
[1, 2, 3]
params(*args, **kw)¶

Assign positional and keyword arguments used when worker() is invoked.

Return type:self (knife object)
pattern(pattern, type='parse', flags=0)¶

Compile search pattern for use as worker().

Global positional and keywordparams() are reset when a pattern is compiled.

Parameters:
  • pattern (string) – search pattern
  • type (string) – engine to compile pattern with. Valid options are ‘parse’, ‘re’, or ‘glob’
  • flags (integer) – regular expression flags
Return type:

self (knife object)

 
>>> # using parse expression
>>> test = __('first test', 'second test', 'third test')
>>> test.pattern('first {}').filter().get()
'first test'
>>> # using glob pattern
>>> test.original().pattern('second*', type='glob').filter().get()
'second test'
>>> # using regular expression
>>> test.original().pattern('third .', type='regex').filter().get()
'third test'
peek()¶

Preview current incoming things wrapped with wrap().

If there’s only one outgoing thing, only that thing will be returned. If there are multiple outgoing things, they will be returned wrapped with wrap().

pipe(knife)¶

Pipe incoming things through another knife.

Parameters:knife – another knife
prepend(*things)¶

Insert things before other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
Return type:self (knife object) 
>>> __(3, 4, 5).prepend(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6).peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 3, 4, 5]
snapshot()¶

Take baseline snapshot of current incoming things.

Return type:self (knife object)
undo(snapshot=0)¶

Restore incoming things to a previous snapshot.

A snapshot of incoming things is automatically taken at the start of each knife operation.

Parameters:snapshot (integer) – number of steps ago 1, 2, 3, etc.
Return type:self (knife object) 
>>> undone = __(1, 2, 3).prepend(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
>>> undone.peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3]
>>> # undo back one step
>>> undone.append(1).undo().peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3]
>>> # undo back one step
>>> undone.append(1).append(2).undo().peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3, 1]
>>> # undo back 2 steps
>>> undone.append(1).append(2).undo(2).peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3, 1]
unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

unicode (str under Python 3) decode() outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) – error handling for decoding issues
Return type:

self (knife object)

 
>>> test = __([1], True, r't', b('i'), u('g'), None, (1,))
>>> test.unicode().oneach().peek()
[u'[1]', u'True', u't', u'i', u'g', u'None', u'(1,)']
union()¶

Discover union within a series of iterable incoming things.

Return type:self (a knife object) 
>>> __([1, 2, 3], [101, 2, 1, 10], [2, 1]).union().get()
[1, 10, 3, 2, 101]
unique()¶

Discover unique incoming things.

Return type:self (a knife object) 
>>> # default behavior
>>> __(1, 2, 1, 3, 1, 4).unique().get()
[1, 2, 3, 4]
>>> # using worker as key function
>>> __(1, 2, 1, 3, 1, 4).worker(round).unique().get()
[1, 2, 3, 4]
worker(worker)¶

Assign callable used to work on incoming things.

Global positional and keyword params() are reset when a new worker is assigned.

Parameters:worker – a callable
Return type:self (knife object)
wrap(wrapper)¶

Assign object, type, or class used to wrap outgoing things.

Default wrapper is list. The default wrapper is reverted to after get() or peek() is invoked.

Parameters:wrapper – an object, type, or class
Return type:self (knife object) 
>>> __(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6).wrap(tuple).peek()
(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
